Summary I am a highly skilled office administrator, particularly with record-keeping and data accuracy, passing audits and complying with regulations. I am proficient at using all the administrative software applications required for my job, including internet browsers, iProcurement, OrderIT, iSpace, Sunflower, MS Word & Excel, Eudora & Zimbra email, and moderate desktop/printer troubleshooting skills. I am a creative-problem solver and will always find a way, usually the best/fastest/most efficient way, to get the job done. My goals are: 
1) to keep my department's space inventory and equipment inventory as accurate as possible so that we pass our annual and biennial audits. 
2) keep my department provisioned with telecom services by submitting orders for them. 
3) expertly coordinate the ad hoc projects which are assigned to me. 
4) general administrative excellence in written communications (both individual emails and mass emails), record-keeping, organization of my desk, emails and files, and my extensive institutional memory gained thru nearly 20 years experience with my employer. rank in Scouting, a Boy Scout must fulfill requirements in the areas of leadership, service, and outdoor skills. Although many options are available to demonstrate proficiency in these areas, a number of specific skills are required to advance through the ranks—Tenderfoot, Second Class, First Class, Star, Life, and Eagle. To advance, a Boy Scout must pass specific tests that are organized by requirements and merit badges.
